summary: Studio 54 in New York City has had many lives. It started as an opera house in 1927, then became a TV studio for CBS. In 1977, it reopened as a famous nightclub during the disco era. Known for its wild parties and celebrity guests, it closed in 1980. Later, it was turned into a Broadway theater, hosting popular shows like *Cabaret*. Today, it's a busy theater with two smaller cabaret venues inside. The club's colorful history is remembered in movies and music.
title: Studio 54
